main event: An Air Force pilot observed two unidentified flying objects near Hermanas, New Mexico on August 24, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were described as round and silver, approximately 6 feet in diameter., One object changed shape to a long gray form and appeared to climb thousands of feet., The sighting lasted approximately 3 minutes before the objects disappeared., They were re-sighted approximately 7 minutes later in close formation., The objects disappeared and reappeared in a manner that led the witness to conclude they exhibited flight capabilities beyond known aircraft.
witness description: Colonel Gerald G. Johnson, an Air Force officer
